title: Hero Banner Layout
reference-overview: The Hero Banner Layout reserves a large area at the top of the screen - underneath the Product Header - that can be used to highlight specific content or set a visual tone.
reference-usage:
The simplicity of the Hero Banner layout makes it ideal to use when you want to push a specific message or ensure that the user notices a specific piece of content. It can be used with either a background image or a background color in order to offset it from the rest of the screen.

The background image version of the Hero Banner can often be used in conjunction with the Banding Layout layout to create a more visually compelling display.
reference-details:
• The banner area spans 100% of the width of the screen.
  • The banner should always be located directly below the Product Header.
  • The default minimum height of the banner area is 300px, but can be configured for each use.
  • The banner area can support either a background image or a background color.
  • The Carousel component can be used in conjunction with the Hero Banner image in order to provide a revolving display of different types of content.
  • The banner area can support any type of content or componet. When additional content is used in the banner area, it will be displayed within the centering content div.
Background Images
The background image will span 100% of the width of the available screen. The image width and height will automatically adjust as the screen changes sizes.
The Image Content Overlay component should be used to display content on top of a background image.
reference-mobile:
• When a background image is used in the Banner area, it will automatically re-size to fit 100% of the width of the mobile screen.
  • Any components used within the content area of the Hero Banner layout will automatically respond according to their specific mobile responsiveness conventions.
reference-example-version-content: This example shows the Hero Banner layout with a sample background color. The color can be changed per project, and the banner can house any type of content.
reference-example-version-content-2: This version shows the use of a background image in the banner area. This is a sample image; the specific image to be used will be determined at the project level. This example also uses the Image Content Overlay on top of the background image.
reference-example-version-content-3: This example shows the Hero Banner layout using a color background in conjunction with the Carousel control.
reference-example-version-content-4: This example shows the Hero Banner layout using a background image in conjunction with the Carousel control.
